meanings.definition: To emerge or come forth into view
meanings.sent1: The sun was immerging from behind the clouds, brightening the sky.
meanings.sent2: The flowers immerged slowly from the ground as spring arrived.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick involved a dove immerging from a hidden compartment.
meanings.sent4: Her talent for singing seemed to immerge suddenly during the performance.
meanings.sent5: The truth will always immerge, no matter how hard one tries to hide it.

meanings.definition: To rise or come up from or as if from immersion
meanings.sent1: The swimmer was immerging from the pool after a refreshing swim.
meanings.sent2: The bubbles immerged to the surface as the diver ascended from the deep water.
meanings.sent3: The toast was so burnt that it seemed to immerge from the toaster completely black.
meanings.sent4: His ideas immerged from a deep well of creativity, surprising everyone.
meanings.sent5: The memories of that day would always immerge whenever she visited the beach.
